objects

Class Company

  • java.lang.Object
    • objects.Company

  • public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
    THis Class describes the Company object which holds a portfolio of Shares owned by Shareholders, Shares the Company has, names of the Company and the current Share price of the Company, and the Stock Symbol used for every operation related to the Company.
    Author:
    Fernando Rodriguez

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Company(java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String stockSymbol, int shares, double sharePrice)
      This the Company Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCompanyName()
      Getter: Returns this Company's Name.
      java.util.ArrayList<Shares> getPortfolio()
      Getter: returns the ArrayList of Shares of this Company owned by Shareholders.
      double getSharePrice()
      Getter: Returns the price per Share of this Company.
      int getShares()
      Getter: Returns the Amount of Shares this Company owns.
      int getSharesold()
      Getter: returns the amount of Shares owned by Shareholders.
      java.lang.String getStockSymbol()
      Getter: Returns the Stock Symbol for this Company.
      java.lang.String report()
      This method will create a report of all of the Company's Shares owned by Shareholders and then output it as a String.
      void setCompanyName(java.lang.String companyName)
      Setter: Assigns a new name for this Company.
      void setSharePrice(double sharePrice)
      Setter: Assigns a new Share price for this Company.
      void setShares(int shares)
      Setter: Assigns a new amount of Shares to the Company.
      void setStockSymbol(java.lang.String stockSymbol)
      Setter: Assigns a new Stock Symbol for this Company.
      void splitStock()
      This method will split the stock for this Company, which means cut the Shares price in half and double the amount of hares for this Company and every other Shareholder of this Company.
      java.lang.String toFile()
      This method converts the Company object into a String line that is used to store this Company's data into the reports.txt file.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method will output a String version of the data related to this Company Object to be displayed in the console.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Company

        public Company(java.lang.String companyName,
               java.lang.String stockSymbol,
               int shares,
               double sharePrice)
        This the Company Constructor
        Parameters:
        companyName - Name of the Company to create .
        stockSymbol - Unique Stock Symbol that identifies this Company.
        shares - Initial Amount of Share (cannot be more than 10,000.
        sharePrice - Shares price for this Company.

      • splitStock

        public void splitStock()
        This method will split the stock for this Company, which means cut the Shares price in half and double the amount of hares for this Company and every other Shareholder of this Company.

      • toFile

        public java.lang.String toFile()
        This method converts the Company object into a String line that is used to store this Company's data into the reports.txt file.
        Returns:
        String version of object of type Company to store in file.

      • report

        public java.lang.String report()
        This method will create a report of all of the Company's Shares owned by Shareholders and then output it as a String.
        Returns:
        String representing the report for this Company.
